intro: Ageratina illita, commonly known as the white cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are often arranged in clusters, giving it a fluffy appearance. Ageratina illita typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and streambanks. Its foliage is usually covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive texture and appearance.
